reviewText: I am a Vietnam disabled veteran - I've been on patrol.  I didn't finish it. It wasn't what I was looking for.
The visual quality of this is so poor that it is unwatchable. Amazon should take this off their list of offerings. Even for $2.00 it is not worth watching.
For when it was produced not bad. For today's standards it wouldn't be reviewed very well.  I wouldn't buy it but for the instant viewing it's alright
Having lived through this period in US history it was interesting to see the Army spin put on the operations of the 9th Div in Viet Nam.
Makes the Vietnam tour of duty sound dirty and uncomfortable, but downplays the very real danger that existed almost constantly.

Not much more to ad.  The quality was too bad to continue watching the whole thing.  In the old days of low def TV this might have appeared fine but in today's High Def this just could not past video quality muster.  I tried to watch it but had to give up.
From the start you have to remember history may differ from the storie on the news. On the news all the intent was to support reasons that we wanted to believe and then our Heros returned.
It gives you a real look at how Vietnam really was back then and not many movies or docs do that
Looks like early propaganda film.
Been there!
great movie
Takes me back to 1969 in the Delta with the 9th ID.  Well done.
Didn't hold my interest. Just watched part of it.
I didn't like it.
White washed a great deal.
does not compare to other videos I have seen about the VietNam war
Almost like a 1970's recruiting film.
Sanitized, watered down version.
It was average at best.
Ok
I read a lot of Vietnam war books.  I enjoyed this book and most of the other ones too.
It's a typical 60's documentary on why we should be in Vietnam and an admiring look at the military. Great footage of Vietnam. Reminds me of the evening news at the time, without Walter Cronkite.
All military produced videos are scripted and staged,

What a load of propaganda garbage. Dialogue is complete fairy tale nonsense.
Video quality is shocking too.
vietnam war propaganda film explaining how we belong their and winning the war. It's as informative as Reefer madness.
brief highlights of some major events..

I read  these books because my dad was in Vietnam. I am just trying to learn what he went thru while serving in Southeast Asia. I have always had a ton of respect for are armed forces. But the more I read, these young men did a great job. Another great read ..
Ok
If you like Headquarter's view of the war, you will like this. But if you are looking for discussion from the everyday soldier, this isn't for you.
True representation of the Vietnam War
Good
Just ok. Mostly hype for the 9th division.  Actually from watching the film, they had it good compared to other units in Vietnam.
good
Anything with Jack Webb is always good...
As a Nam vet I would say it's close, but all vets have their on feelings on how things went for them. A good read none the less.
So so. It's ok, not great.
A good unit documentary.
Why a 5 star? To balance the IDIOTS who complain about the video quality of TV footage from the late 1960's to early 1970. Gee, I wonder why it isn't as good as 2015?? Derp?
Film quality is poor.
We didn't watch it because it wasn't what we thought it was going to be. We were thinking of TOUR OF DUTY.

Eisenhower wanted no part of this conflict, Kennedy was smitten, LBJ inherited it and nurtured it, Nixon ended it. Like this movie the culpable seemed to slip right by and last one holding the prize loses.

As a USMC veteran of 23 months in Vietnam, I found this to be a bogus depiction of what was happening in Vietnam at the time.  It was one sided and failed to tell the story.  It showed the US wining the conflict and assured everyone of our eventual victory.  Far too much reporting by US forces was exaggerations and outright lies.  This film is full of willful blindness.
just okay

Those who bag on this film don't understand what they are looking at. This is a US Army training film, most likely used to indoctrinate those soldiers who just arrived in country. The film is accurate and excellent, even though it was a bit out of focus. Someone called this film a whitewash. That person has no idea of why we were there and what we did. People should know about this war before they condemn it.
Refund
good
I felt as if I was watching a film for propaganda purposes. Watch it if you will, but it's a whitewash of the real Vietnam War.
It was worth watching.

If one understands that the film is a 100% U.S. Military production not to be mistaken for a Hollywood entertainment production, it will be appreciated for what it is, namely, a quite good historical perspective of a War that to this very day still triggers the emotions of our Great Nation. Merry Christmas & Happy Holidays To All!
Ugly time in America and ugly time for me.  This is okay it just brings up bad memories.  Watch if you can.
Terrible quality of the video. It's a shame. This is an important subject.
I did not see this movie...
Great
Old but interesting.
This shows the conditions our men had to fight under. Also if you do not fight to win why fight at all
It's not bad, old footage
Typical documentary, only showed what made us look good.
Government propaganda film
good
It  was  not the show  that i thought it  was  i thought it  was  the  tv  seies  tour of  duty, but  it  wasnt.

First, this is a very low quality digital transfer of an old 16mm film.  I suspect that someone with an 8mm camera was copying it in the back of the tent and that copy made this video.  I saw the original a very long time ago.  Please be sure to recognize that this is a propaganda film produced by the US Army.  Most of what is stated in this is just not accurate and much of it could be challenged as a lie.  It was made to get high school students to answer a call to combat and not burn their draft cards or high tail it to Canada.

Very nice documentary  Informative and insightful  focusing on the 9th Infantry Divison "The Old Reliables" and it's Mekong Delta and vicinity operations. Originally titled "The 9th Infantry Division in Viet Nam" part of The Big Picture series by the US Army.

It was like jumping back to 1966-67 when I fought in viet-nam with the 4th infantry and the 101st abn div .it was a good time and a bad time being with my buddies and living and dying together.its kind of hard to give a rating to a movie so I'll just say that it wash good.there's no such thing as an excellent war movie.i hope that what I say is alright.
This one was just okay and was not what I had anticipated in a movie about the Republic Of Viet Nam

Maybe it's coming from hindsight but this film is typical Army PR BS. It makes everything sound so wonderful and our guys were so happy to be a part of it all. I agree units have their pride and rightfully so but this was just a bit much to swallow.
These were boring when I had to watch them in the military and even worse when I am no longer in the military and required to see it.  Plus, this training film is from the 60s

Very poor quality film - so bad that even on close up filming it is so out of focus or "fuzzy" that nothing is clear.  Don't know, maybe a case of jungle rot got into the film canister.  Regardless, I could only watch about 5 minutes before giving up.
Low grade quality, at least at the beginning, so I did not continue watching it.  I may have gotten better....
Such an Indoc movie with it's whimsical theatrical music. Vietnam is not that bad...you'll love it there!
Didn't finish
Good army propaganda film.
narrated..I hate narrated..I want a good old war movie..Ill have to track them down,,I love war movies,,so I watch them..
Not what I wanted; looking for the TV show tour of Duty.
I didn't like it.
was ok
Interesting.
